   #include <stdio.h>
   #include <stdbool.h>
   #include <string.h>
   #include <ctype.h>

   // Function to check leap year (same as in first program)
   bool check_leap(int y) {
        return (y % 400 == 0) || (y % 4 == 0 && y % 100 != 0);
   }

   int main() {
        int y;
        scanf("%d", &y);

        // Step 1: Compute next year n
        bool leap = check_leap(y);
        int sum = 0;
        int n = y + 1;
        while (1) {
            if (check_leap(n)) {
                sum += 366;
            } else {
                sum += 365;
            }
            if (sum % 7 == 0) {
                if ((check_leap(n) && leap) || (!check_leap(n) && !leap)) {
                    break;
                }
            }
            n++;
        }
        // Now n is the result of the first program.

        // Step 2: Process the year n as a string to find the last non-space, non-question-mark character.
        // Convert n to a string. We don't know the number of digits, but maximum 10 digits.
        char year_str[12]; // enough for 10 digits and sign and null
        sprintf(year_str, "%d", n);
        int len = strlen(year_str);
        char last_char = 0;
        // Traverse backwards to find the last non-space and non-question-mark.
        // Since the string is a number, we can just take the last character.
        for (int i = len - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
            if (year_str[i] != ' ' && year_str[i] != '?') {
                last_char = tolower(year_str[i]);
                break;
            }
        }

        // Now check if last_char is a vowel or 'y'
        char vowels[] = "aeiouy";
        bool is_vowel = false;
        for (int i = 0; vowels[i] != '\0'; i++) {
            if (last_char == vowels[i]) {
                is_vowel = true;
                break;
            }
        }

        // The second program outputs "YES" or "NO". We don't output it, but we need to form the input to the third program.
        char second_output[4]; // either "YES" or "NO" -> max 4? "YES" is 3+null, "NO" is 2+null -> so 4 is safe.
        if (is_vowel) {
            strcpy(second_output, "YES");
        } else {
            strcpy(second_output, "NO");
        }

        // Step 3: Process the string second_output as the third program.
        // The third program: 
        //    Build a frequency map for the string second_output.
        int freq[256] = {0}; // frequency table for ASCII characters.
        int distinct = 0;
        int i;
        for (i = 0; second_output[i] != '\0'; i++) {
            unsigned char c = second_output[i];
            if (freq[c] == 0) {
                distinct++;
            }
            freq[c]++;
        }
        int len_str = i; // length of the string

        bool ok = true;
        // We have to check that every character that appears has frequency 2.
        for (int j = 0; j < 256; j++) {
            if (freq[j] != 0) {
                if (freq[j] != 2) {
                    ok = false;
                    break;
                }
            }
        }
        // Also, the number of distinct characters must be 2.
        if (ok && distinct == 2) {
            printf("Yes\n");
        } else {
            printf("No\n");
        }

        return 0;
   }
